intro: Navarretia lemmonii, commonly known as Lemmon's navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It is often found in California and parts of Nevada, thriving in full sun. Navarretia lemmonii is a short-lived perennial, often blooming in early spring before going dormant.
